name: Pierre & Vacances Residence Les Chalets de Solaise

reviews.text: Location is superb – close to everything! Apartments are very small so don’t go for the max nr of persons allowed but for the money we paid I would not expect much better . Pool is nice though small. Lounge is nice if you go with bigger group though it is not very cozy. Val dÍsere is very nice small city, with a lot of good restaurants, cafes, shops. On the other hand ski slopes are not maintained at all – really shame for such a place.
reviews.title: Great location, good value for a money

reviews.text: Rooms: Like others who have wrote a review on here i would say the same about the room sizes and of it being basic but we were very happy with it. Had a room for 4, you have 1 room which consists of both bedroom & living room plus a little kitchenette. We had a pull down double bed from the wall and a sofa bed which had another single sofa bed underneath it which you pull out from underneath. We had to make up the bed's when we arrived which is no big deal. We re-arranged the room to give us more room as we left the beds up permanently, we felt we had adequate room. Tv in room with 1 english speaking channel (euro sport) the rest were french channels, this was fine as we weren't there to stay in our room. On the 2 occasions when we were a bit worn out from the slopes all day and stayed in for the night we just entertained ourselves with making a meal, having a few beers and chilling. I took my laptop along with me and the footage that we filmed of us skiing on the slopes were entertainment enough for us to watch by plugging the laptop into the tv : ) There are adequate side tables, chest of drawers and a 4 seater kitchen table with chairs as well as your beds to chill out/sit on. We had storage and coat hangers for our clothes. All rooms have a small balcony which i found bliss, ours looked out onto other buildings which was fine and we could see the top of one slope.
reviews.title: Stayed here 10th - 17th March 2012

reviews.text: Bathroom: We didn't have a problem with the bathroom, big enough for us. Bath and Shower, separate toilet and double basin's. Nice and clean and spacious. Our toilet was broken on arrival but as soon as we informed reception they sent someone up and fixed it straight away. Staff were brilliant.
reviews.title: Definitely not a 4 start

reviews.text: Kitchen(ette): Basic but had everything we needed; sink,microwave, cookertop, fridge, dishwasher, kettle, coffemaker, plenty of cutlery/dishes/plates/cups/saucepans etc No oven but the microwave was a combination thing, which we kind of sussed out eventually : )
reviews.title: Good value for low price

reviews.text: Reception: We didn't need them often but when we did they were helpful and courteous, very pleasant.
reviews.title: Average could do with updating then it would be fine
Great location and value for money
reviews.text: Excellent position, complimented with smart clean rooms, fitted to a good standard giving us great value for money.
Pool and leisure facilities where a must to relax those tiered muscles after a long days skiing. A very welcoming open fire was lit each evening in the comfortable and spacious common lounge area.
reviews.title: Excellent location at the centre of the Village
AS Described- stay with confidence
reviews.text: Shop and secure boot/ski room was an added bonus.
Would definatley return upon skiing Val again
reviews.title: Caring staff attitude - Not

reviews.text: Excellent location at the centre of the Village, offering affordable if slightly tired self-catering accommodation.
reviews.title: Wonderful Val D'Isere

reviews.text: We stayed at the residence in April 2010 and were really impressed with the accommodation. 4 of us were very comfortable in a mezzanine apartment and thought that it was fully equipped with everything we needed. We didn't spend hours in the apartment but there were enough chairs for all of us. I wouldn't have wanted to have anymore people staying in their though. The underground on site car park was really handy and made unpacking less of a chore than we imagined after the drive from the UK. The staff could not have been more helpful and the pool and sauna were a great bonus. The residence is close to the centre of town so getting food from the supermarket or going out for a drink was not a problem. Supermarkets however aren't cheap in Val d'Isere so stopping before the resort is recommended. We did not find the walk to the bus stop or the slopes a hassle but with small children and lots of kit I would leave more time in the morning. All in all we had a good holiday and would return without hesitation.
reviews.title: Excellent location and comfortable accommodation

reviews.text: The place is very worn and shows signs of significant decay. The indoor climate is the worst we have ever experienced in the French ski apartments. The apartment is very worn, furniture that bears the hallmark of many years of use, and a carpet that looked alive!
reviews.title: false trade description

reviews.text: The gym was something old - 8 m2 of space, 3 old machines, room temperature 7 degrees - not acceptable.
reviews.title: Great location, excellent for groups of friends or families looking for central location in Val

reviews.text: P & V takes an overcharge of at least 30%
reviews.title: if i am in val d,isere again, i will stay at pierre et vacances. thank you.

reviews.text: Went to PV chalets earlier this month with friends. Hotel has all that is needed as base for a great holiday. Staff very friendly and accommodation comfortable. Although refurb would benefit the hotel this did not detract from the experience.
reviews.title: Surprisingly comfortable and affordable accommodation within easy reach of resort centre.

reviews.text: I stayed at these appartments last week for 3 nights. Before i left i checked trip advisor and was a bit worried about where we were going to end up !!
reviews.title: great!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However my worries were quickley dismissed when we got into our appartment,Fantastic. The appartment had been full refurbed and is one of the best ski hotels i have stayed in. The only downside is the public areas which do need to be refurbished. The sauna and pool areas were good as is the location,a very central hotel.
reviews.title: Bring Your Own Toilet Rolls...

reviews.text: Enjoy..
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: This place has definitely seen better days. It has a reasonably good location (except if you're dragging skis) but not much else positive to say. The pool that is prominant in the photos on the P&V website was shut and covered during the entire stay, the bed was a pull down from the wall that we had to make ourselves, and the kicker was the 2 sheets left on a toilet roll and being told we had to buy any extras ourselves. Given the supermarkets (which are very good and close by) sell in minimum of 4 I think the C de S is doing a roaring trade on the resale of toilet rolls! Val D'Isere itself is a great place to visit / ski.
reviews.title: Never again!
Central. Nothing else going for it.
reviews.text: Basic apartment but good value as Val D'Isere is quite expensive. Has everything you need for self cateriing including dishwasher, fridge, hob and microwave but no oven. Decent sized bathroom with shower. Studio has 1 double bed and 2 singles plus table and 4 chairs. There is also a heated outdoor swimming pool which is fun to use in the evening when it's dark outside. Fairly central to shops and restaurants and reasonably close to ski lifts (about 10 mins walk). Staff are friendly and helpful.

aka: Pierre & Vacances Residence Les Chalets De Solaise Hotel
description: Resort at the heart of the Espace Killy Residence located at the heart of the resort. Comfortable ski apartments with access to the outdoor heated swimming pool and wellness area.
